other_tests.findings: Centrally located area with irregular borders showing hypoautofluorescence because of RPE atrophy with a surrounding rim of hyperautofluorescence consistent with RPE damage. Area of hypoautofluorescence around the optic discs at the site of atrophy.
Granular hyperfluorescence in the macula and concomitant areas of fenestrated loss with visible choriocapillaris. No obvious abnormalities in contrast flow through the main vessels.

Lowering of a and b waves in light-adapted 3 ERG and LA 30 Hz ERG with prolonged peak times of a and b waves under photopic adaptation conditions (significantly worse in the RE). Normal dark-adapted ERG results.
Homozygous mutation in CDHR1 (NM_033100.4:c.783G>A). This splice region variant is classified as pathogenic.
